column4: Anyone with an OGG/Vorbis file and Rhythmbox? Does it crash if you play the OGG and then while playing rewind it to the beginning?
rhythmbox has lots of bugs, unfortunately
It does have a lot of bugs, but it will *continue* to have a lot of bugs if people don't report bugs like this, which is why I want to know if other people experience the same bug.
I'll need to try this out in the newer version of Rhythmbox though, since this is 0.8.5 from Warty.
did you update while it was running?
Hm... I might have. There were some packages that needed an upgrade after the installation.
quit and restart it
firefox doesn't like being upgraded while it's running (known bug)
Yep. That helped. Thanks.
np
I should had tried that, but I was under the impression it was still a fresh installation, so I figured restarting was pointless.
ah
User interface testing doesn't actually equal "caring what users think".
how so?  you think they paid for it then ignored the results?
GNOME is concerned about usability a lot, but often if a user says "I would really like feature X." they might not listen.
see, users can't just say "I want foo" and complain if foo doesn't get implemented
No, but I think the people doing the testing aren't actual users.
how do you know that?
I don't, but it'd be a pretty stupid test if all the testers were experienced GNOME-users.
of course, hence I'd be very surprised if they did that
I don't have an example of that, except that I'm pissed that there's no menu editor.
But it's more of a comparison to KDE. I understand they've been quite "helpful" in implementing a lot of stuff users requested, which has resulted in crowded menus and such.
